Uses of Class
chess.Piece

  • Uses of Piece in chess

    Subclasses of Piece in chess 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  Bishop
    This class implements the logic that governs how a Bishop operates in a game of chess.
    class  King
    This class implements the logic that governs how a King operates in a game of chess.
    class  Knight
    This class implements the logic that governs how a Knight operates in a game of chess.
    class  Pawn
    This class implements the logic that governs how a Pawn operates in a game of chess.
    class  Queen
    This class implements the logic that governs how a Queen operates in a game of chess.
    class  Rook
    This class implements the logic that governs how a Rook operates in a game of chess.
    Fields in chess declared as Piece 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    Piece[][] Game.board
    Defines the game board, made up of all Pieces on the board at any time in an 8 by 8 array.

    Piece Game.findPiece​(java.lang.String token)
    Finds and returns the Piece on the Board given a certain input from the user.
    Methods in chess with parameters of type Piece 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void Bishop.generateValidMoves​(Piece[][] board)
    The logic for how a Bishop generates the legal moves available to it.

    Abstract method that is implemented in the subclasses.
    void Queen.generateValidMoves​(Piece[][] board)
    The logic for how a Queen generates the legal moves available to it.
    void Rook.generateValidMoves​(Piece[][] board)
    The logic for how a Rook generates the legal moves available to it.
    private boolean King.isSafeForSliding​(int x, int y, Piece[][] board)
    Helper method used to ensure that castling is a valid more for the king.
    boolean King.move​(Piece[][] board, int x, int y, int color)
    Move method specific to how the King operates when they move given their special move set.
    boolean Pawn.move​(Piece[][] board, int x, int y, int color)
    Move method specific to how a Pawn operates when they move given their special move set.
    boolean Piece.move​(Piece[][] board, int x, int y, int color)
    A general move method that handles most pieces just fine.
    void Bishop.path​(Piece[][] board, int deltaX, int deltaY)
    Generates valid moves in a line of attack as defined by generateValidMoves.
    void Queen.path​(Piece[][] board, int deltaX, int deltaY)
    Generates valid moves in a line of attack as defined by generateValidMoves.
    void Rook.path​(Piece[][] board, int deltaX, int deltaY)
    Generates valid moves in a line of attack as defined by generateValidMoves.
    void Bishop.pathUnderCheck​(Piece[][] board, int deltaX, int deltaY)
    Modified version of path when under the added constraint that the King of this current color is under check.
    void Queen.pathUnderCheck​(Piece[][] board, int deltaX, int deltaY)
    Modified version of path when under the added constraint that the King of this current color is under check.
    void Rook.pathUnderCheck​(Piece[][] board, int deltaX, int deltaY)
    Modified version of path when under the added constraint that the King of this current color is under check.
    void Piece.shield​(Piece[][] board, int x, int y, int deltaX, int deltaY)
    Designates the location of the attacker that the piece is shielding the King from.
    boolean King.updateStatus​(Piece[][] board)
    Simulates what would happen if the King moved to a new square.
